ALFRESCO post-processing of fire events

These functions are used for post-processing of ALFRESCO fire events from map outputs.

fireEventsFun(k, pts, locs, replicates, source = "Modeled",
  buffer.list = list(NULL), buffer.labels = LETTERS[1:length(buffer.list)],
  burnable_cells = NULL, main_dir)

fireEventsFunEmpirical(b, pts, locs, replicates = "Observed",
  source = "Observed", buffer.list = list(NULL),
  buffer.labels = LETTERS[1:length(buffer.list)], burnable_cells = NULL)

Arguments

k

integer, an iterator.
pts

table of point locations.
locs

location names
replicates

character, simulation replicate labels.
source

character, "Observed" or "Modeled".
buffer.list

list of point location buffers in meters.
buffer.labels

labels for buffers in list.
burnable_cells

binary raster of possibly burnable cells.
main_dir

directory path.
b

a raster brick.

Value

a list.

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value

Developed by Matthew Leonawicz, Scenarios Network for Alaska and Arctic Planning.
